sen.j: 松本 佐多（まつもと さた、本名愛子、1873年-1955年）は祇園甲部の芸妓、上方舞井上流の日本舞踊家。
sen.e: Sata MATSUMOTO (real first name was Aiko, 1873 - 1955) was a geigi (another term for geisha; female Japanese entertainer trained in various Japanese arts such as classical music and dancing) in the Gion Kobu district and a master of the Classical Japanese dance in the Inoue school of Kamigatamai.

sen.j: 佐多は父、虎次郎、母、とみの娘として一力亭近くの置屋（置屋）『増富』でうまれ、幼少のころに両親を亡くし、『増富』の芸妓、小美勇の養女となる。
sen.e: Sata was born as a daughter of father Torajiro and mother Tomi at a geisha house "Masutomi" near the Ichiriki-tei Teahouse, and lost both parents in her infancy and was adopted by Komiyu who was a geigi in the geisha house "Masutomi".

sen.e: Sata also devoted to training of her juniors as Yachiyo INOUE's right hand, and in 1948, successfully gave a performance of Inoue school dance in Tokyo, though the Inoue school dance had not been allowed to be performed outside the district; and for those achievements, she was awarded Culture Prize from the Kyoto Culture Academy in 1950, and Art Prize in 1952.
